intro: Zeocriton murinum, commonly known as the mouse ear cress, is a small flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves and small white or yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant is native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Zeocriton murinum is an annual or biennial herb that thrives in well-drained environments. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution across its native range.
